author: PaulHigin
body:
This is a list of Windows PowerShell items we should consider porting to PSCore 6.
I'll update this list as needed.

- [ ] TFS:12717061
- [ ] TFS:12318294
- [ ] TFS:12204519
- [ ] TFS:11658687
- [ ] TFS:11711916
- [ ] TFS:11445884
- [ ] TFS:10756506
- [ ] TFS:12405614
- [ ] TFS:11818697
- [ ] TFS:11446093
- [ ] TFS:11211805

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I updated it to have checkboxes so we can just check them off as completed

comments.author: mi-hol
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT will the changes listed show up in a preview?

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Interesting!

Is there a way to list a summary description of these fixes?  Forgot to ask ... are they going to be discussed at the meeting today?


:)

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: VSTS offers now the feature (in private preview at the moment) of allowing the public a read-only view of a VSTS instance. This could be useful to see those referenced items @SteveL-MSFT

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @bergmeister the TFS id's above come from the uber Windows TFS.  Not only do I not have permission to make something publicly read-only, I doubt Windows org would do that.  The changes will show up in the PSCore6 changelog after the change is ported.

title: Consider porting Windows PowerShell changes to PSCore6
